highlights: Created a new express.js and mongodb backend for monkeytype.com, an open-source typing website with 4k stars on Github and 100k daily unique site visitors.
Rewrote front-end javascript to enable usage of the new api
Reduced website's costs from about $500 per month to about $150 per month
Communicated extensively with lead developer and another teammate
Used javascript, mongodb, node.js, express.js, linux and git

projects.description: Created a website where users can post their ideas and share them with others or simply manage for their own personal use. Deployed the site to a linux server using nginx.
projects.name: Ideaspot
mathgenerator
projects.description: Created and maintain a python package that generates math problems. Use Github Actions to test, format, and deploy to pypi. Have merged 217 pull requests from 71 unique contributors.

projects.name: Ghlog
projects.description: Created a command line application to upload journal entries to a github repository.

projects.name: BeautifulVHS
projects.description: Created a website that displays a moving, 3d rendering of old vhs covers. Wrote a python script to automatically crop panels from pictures.

projects.name: Londree
projects.description: Currently creating a mobile/web app to keep track of the availability of laundry machines inside college dorms using React Native.

projects.name: Todarith
projects.description: Created a website that hosted a database of user-submitted and machine-generated math problems.

projects.name: Recolorbot
projects.description: Created a reddit bot that colors black and white images using an image coloring API. Host the converted images on a python web server.

projects.name: Worksheetgen
projects.description: Created a python package that creates a printable math worksheet. Designed to be generated automatically with mathgenerator.

Created a python program that takes in a video of a slideshow presentation and uses opencv to detect differences in slides. Creates a pdf containing each slide shown in the video. Also created a website that allows users to have a minimal web interface to the tool.
projects.name: Vid2slides
